segments.en: Hello, everyone, and welcome to EnglishPod.
segments.cn: 大家好，欢迎来到EnglishPod。

segments.en: My name is Marco.
segments.cn: 我叫Marco。

segments.en: My name is Catherine, and today we have a very romantic dialogue for you.
segments.cn: 我叫Catherine，今天我们有一个非常浪漫的对话给你们。

segments.en: That's right, today we are at a shop and we are buying jewelry.
segments.cn: 没错，今天我们在一家店里，正在购买珠宝。

segments.en: So, of course, there are many different types of jewelry and stones, so we're going to take a look at all that great stuff.
segments.cn: 当然，有很多不同类型的珠宝和宝石，我们将看看这些美妙的东西。

segments.en: Let's jump into our dialogue and see what's going on.
segments.cn: 让我们跳入对话，看看发生了什么。

segments.en: Good afternoon, sir.
segments.cn: 下午好，先生。

segments.en: Is there anything I can help you with today?
segments.cn: 今天有什么我可以帮助您的吗？

segments.en: Um, yeah.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的。

segments.en: I'm looking for a nice gift to give my girlfriend.
segments.cn: 我在找一个送给我女朋友的好礼物。

segments.en: Our fifth anniversary is next Friday.
segments.cn: 我们的第五个周年纪念日是下周五。

segments.en: Well, I would be happy to assist you in choosing the perfect gift for her.
segments.cn: 好的，我很乐意帮助您选择完美的礼物。

segments.en: Is there anything in particular that you have in mind?
segments.cn: 您有没有特别想要的东西？

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，没什么特别的。

segments.en: I'm completely at a loss.
segments.cn: 我完全不知道该选什么。

segments.en: Well, you can give her a set of Pearl earrings, or this beautiful heart-shaped pendant.
segments.cn: 那么，您可以送她一对珍珠耳环，或者这个美丽的心形吊坠。

segments.en: What is her favorite gemstone?
segments.cn: 她最喜欢的宝石是什么？

segments.en: That purple one.
segments.cn: 那个紫色的。

segments.en: I'm sorry, I've never bought jewelry for anyone and I'm kind of nervous.
segments.cn: 对不起，我从来没有给任何人买过珠宝，我有点紧张。

segments.en: Don't worry, we specialize in providing our customers a relaxed, pressure-free shopping environment.
segments.cn: 别担心，我们专注于为客户提供轻松、无压力的购物环境。

segments.en: That stone is an amethyst.
segments.cn: 那块石头是紫水晶。

segments.en: We have a range of beautiful amethyst pieces.
segments.cn: 我们有一系列美丽的紫水晶饰品。

segments.en: Take a look at this bracelet.
segments.cn: 看看这个手链。

segments.en: It's 18 karat Rose gold, studded with amethyst and blue topaz.
segments.cn: 它是18K玫瑰金，镶嵌着紫水晶和蓝色托帕石。

segments.en: It's a great statement piece.
segments.cn: 这是一个很棒的声明作品。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
segments.cn: 哦，哇。

segments.en: That's really pretty.
segments.cn: 这真的很漂亮。

segments.en: Jess would love that.
segments.cn: Jess会喜欢这个。

segments.en: But I was thinking of something a little more delicate.
segments.cn: 但我在想一些更精致的东西。

segments.en: Perhaps a necklace?
segments.cn: 也许是一条项链？

segments.en: We have this beautiful platinum pendant.
segments.cn: 我们有这个美丽的铂金吊坠。

segments.en: Or you could also get her a locket.
segments.cn: 或者您也可以给她买一个挂坠。

segments.en: You could also get her a timepiece.
segments.cn: 您还可以给她买一个时计。

segments.en: It's both glamorous and functional.
segments.cn: 它既华丽又实用。

segments.en: If you tell me a little more about your girlfriend, maybe I can help you find something for her.
segments.cn: 如果您多告诉我一些关于您女朋友的事，也许我可以帮助您找到适合她的东西。

segments.en: Jess?
segments.cn: Jess？

segments.en: Well, she's very smart.
segments.cn: 她非常聪明。

segments.en: She has a great sense of humor.
segments.cn: 她有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: She's very feminine.
segments.cn: 她非常女性化。

segments.en: Perhaps you could give her a ring.
segments.cn: 也许您可以给她一个戒指。

segments.en: Well, actually, I was thinking about asking Jess to marry me.
segments.cn: 其实，我在考虑向Jess求婚。

segments.en: I've just been so nervous.
segments.cn: 我一直很紧张。

segments.en: Well, sir, I believe your fifth anniversary is a great time to propose.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，我认为您的第五个周年纪念日是个很好的求婚时机。

segments.en: Okay, I've decided.
segments.cn: 好的，我决定了。

segments.en: I'm going to pop the question.
segments.cn: 我要向她求婚。

segments.en: Fabulous.
segments.cn: 太棒了。

segments.en: We should look at engagement rings, then.
segments.cn: 那我们应该看看订婚戒指。

segments.en: Now, that's a whole other section.
segments.cn: 现在，那是另一个区域。

segments.en: Alright, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now, let's take a look at language takeaway.
segments.cn: 现在，让我们看看语言要点。

segments.en: Language takeaway.
segments.cn: 语言要点。

segments.en: In language takeaway, we have a lot of jewelry words and terms for you.
segments.cn: 在语言要点中，我们有很多珠宝词汇和术语给您。

segments.en: So let's take a look at some of these.
segments.cn: 让我们看看其中一些。

segments.en: The first one I want to talk about, Marco, is Pearl earrings.
segments.cn: 我想谈的第一个是珍珠耳环。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: The sales assistant offered a set of Pearl earrings.
segments.cn: 销售助理提供了一对珍珠耳环。

segments.en: So we have earrings that you wear on your ears, right?
segments.cn: 所以我们有耳环，您戴在耳朵上，对吧？

segments.en: Usually girls.
segments.cn: 通常是女孩。

segments.en: Yes.
segments.cn: 是的。

segments.en: But what about Pearl?
segments.cn: 但是珍珠呢？

segments.en: Pearls are a kind of decoration that comes from inside an animal.
segments.cn: 珍珠是一种来自动物内部的装饰。

segments.en: The clam is a sea animal that opens up, and inside there might be a little Pearl.
segments.cn: 蛤蜊是一种海洋动物，它会打开，里面可能有一颗小珍珠。

segments.en: It's usually a white or pink, very, very pretty object.
segments.cn: 通常是白色或粉色，非常非常漂亮的物体。

segments.en: And we sometimes put them in earrings or on a necklace.
segments.cn: 我们有时把它们放在耳环或项链上。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So a set of Pearl earrings or earrings that have this little rock or this little marble-looking thing on it.
segments.cn: 所以一对珍珠耳环或带有这个小石头或小大理石状物体的耳环。

segments.en: And, well, he also offered a beautiful heart-shaped pendant.
segments.cn: 而且，他还提供了一个美丽的心形吊坠。

segments.en: Okay, a pendant is a kind of necklace.
segments.cn: 好的，吊坠是一种项链。

segments.en: And basically a pendant is something that hangs down.
segments.cn: 基本上，吊坠是挂下来的东西。

segments.en: So in this case, it's a necklace that might have something on the bottom that hangs down, like in the shape of a heart.
segments.cn: 所以在这种情况下，它是一条可能在底部有东西挂下来的项链，像心形。

segments.en: So that's what heart-shaped means.
segments.cn: 所以这就是心形的意思。

segments.en: It means that it has the shape of a heart.
segments.cn: 它的形状像心。

segments.en: Like, for example, you can have a heart-shaped cake.
segments.cn: 例如，您可以有一个心形蛋糕。

segments.en: You can also have a heart-shaped face.
segments.cn: 您也可以有一个心形的脸。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: And of course the pendant is a little thing that hangs from the necklace.
segments.cn: 当然，吊坠是挂在项链上的小东西。

segments.en: Now, maybe some pendants can also have a gemstone, and that's our next word.
segments.cn: 现在，也许一些吊坠也可以有宝石，这就是我们的下一个词。

segments.en: So a gemstone is not just a normal stone.
segments.cn: 所以宝石不仅仅是普通的石头。

segments.en: It's a beautiful, normally expensive stone.
segments.cn: 它是一种美丽的，通常昂贵的石头。

segments.en: And we often have gemstones that relate to a person's birthday.
segments.cn: 我们通常有与一个人生日相关的宝石。

segments.en: Right, right.
segments.cn: 对，没错。

segments.en: So these come in many different colors and types.
segments.cn: 所以这些有很多不同的颜色和类型。

segments.en: The two that we heard about in today's dialogue are purple and blue.
segments.cn: 今天对话中提到的两种是紫色和蓝色。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: The purple stone that you're talking about is the one that the shop assistant suggested, which is amethyst.
segments.cn: 你说的紫色石头是店员推荐的，就是紫水晶。

segments.en: Amethyst is a purple stone.
segments.cn: 紫水晶是一种紫色的石头。

segments.en: It's really, really pretty, and it's sometimes light, sometimes a little bit darker.
segments.cn: 它真的非常漂亮，有时是浅色，有时稍微深一点。

segments.en: Depends on the one that you're looking at.
segments.cn: 这取决于您看的那一块。

segments.en: But amethyst is a little bit difficult to say, but it's a kind of gemstone.
segments.cn: 但紫水晶有点难说，但它是一种宝石。

segments.en: The other one we heard about is called topaz.
segments.cn: 另一个我们听到的是叫托帕石。

segments.en: Okay, a topaz, and this one is blue.
segments.cn: 好的，托帕石，这个是蓝色的。

segments.en: So I guess they all look very much like diamonds, but they are different colors.
segments.cn: 所以我想它们看起来都很像钻石，但颜色不同。

segments.en: So topaz looks like a blue diamond, kind of.
segments.cn: 所以托帕石看起来像蓝色的钻石。

segments.en: Right, and Ruby is red.
segments.cn: 对，红宝石是红色的。

segments.en: And Ruby is red.
segments.cn: 红宝石是红色的。

segments.en: Very good.
segments.cn: 非常好。

segments.en: I think there's a black one that's called onyx.
segments.cn: 我想有一种黑色的叫做玛瑙。

segments.en: Onyx is black.
segments.cn: 玛瑙是黑色的。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Okay, so many different types of gemstones.
segments.cn: 好的，有很多不同类型的宝石。

segments.en: And as Catherine said, usually each month has a specific gemstone.
segments.cn: 正如凯瑟琳所说，通常每个月都有一种特定的宝石。

segments.en: So that's considered your gemstone if you were born on that month.
segments.cn: 所以如果你在那个月份出生，那就是你的宝石。

segments.en: All right, now moving on to our next word.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们继续下一个词。

segments.en: We have another type of jewelry that usually hangs from a necklace, just like a pendant, but on this occasion it's a locket.
segments.cn: 我们有另一种通常挂在项链上的珠宝，就像吊坠，但这次是一个怀表。

segments.en: Okay, a locket is something that usually women will wear around their necks.
segments.cn: 好的，怀表通常是女性佩戴在脖子上的。

segments.en: Now this is like a pendant, but it opens.
segments.cn: 这就像一个吊坠，但它可以打开。

segments.en: So it's something that can open up, and sometimes people have photographs inside.
segments.cn: 所以它是可以打开的，有时人们会在里面放照片。

segments.en: Many times they're shaped like a heart or a book.
segments.cn: 很多时候它们的形状像心形或书本。

segments.en: And inside you can see a picture or a note, something very personal.
segments.cn: 里面你可以看到一张照片或一张便条，非常个人化的东西。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So it's very similar to a pendant, but as you said, it opens up.
segments.cn: 所以它和吊坠非常相似，但正如你所说，它可以打开。

segments.en: You see it all the time in movies.
segments.cn: 你在电影中经常看到它。

segments.en: People have pendants, and inside they have a nice picture of someone.
segments.cn: 人们有吊坠，里面有某人的漂亮照片。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: So that's a locket.
segments.cn: 所以这就是怀表。

segments.en: All right, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: I think we've taken a look at a lot of vocab related to jewelry here.
segments.cn: 我想我们已经看了很多与珠宝相关的词汇。

segments.en: Why don't we go back, let's review this dialogue, and we'll be back in a bit.
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去，复习一下这个对话，稍后再回来。

segments.en: Good afternoon, sir.
segments.cn: 下午好，先生。

segments.en: Is there anything I can help you with today?
segments.cn: 今天有什么我可以帮助您的吗？

segments.en: Um, yeah.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的。

segments.en: I'm looking for a nice gift to give my girlfriend.
segments.cn: 我在找一个送给我女朋友的好礼物。

segments.en: Our fifth anniversary is next Friday.
segments.cn: 我们的第五个周年纪念日是下周五。

segments.en: Well, I would be happy to assist you in choosing the perfect gift for her.
segments.cn: 好吧，我很乐意帮助您选择完美的礼物。

segments.en: Is there anything in particular that you have in mind?
segments.cn: 您有没有特别想要的东西？

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，没什么特别的。

segments.en: I'm completely at a loss.
segments.cn: 我完全不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: Well, you can give her a set of Pearl earrings or this beautiful heart-shaped pendant.
segments.cn: 好吧，您可以送她一对珍珠耳环或这个漂亮的心形吊坠。

segments.en: What is her favorite gemstone?
segments.cn: 她最喜欢的宝石是什么？

segments.en: That purple one.
segments.cn: 那个紫色的。

segments.en: I'm sorry, I've never bought jewelry for anyone, and I'm kind of nervous.
segments.cn: 对不起，我从来没有给任何人买过珠宝，我有点紧张。

segments.en: Don't worry.
segments.cn: 别担心。

segments.en: We specialize in providing our customers a relaxed, pressure-free shopping environment.
segments.cn: 我们专注于为客户提供轻松、无压力的购物环境。

segments.en: That stone is an amethyst.
segments.cn: 那块石头是紫水晶。

segments.en: We have a range of beautiful amethyst pieces.
segments.cn: 我们有一系列美丽的紫水晶饰品。

segments.en: Take a look at this bracelet.
segments.cn: 看看这个手链。

segments.en: It's 18 karat Rose gold studded with amethyst and blue topaz.
segments.cn: 它是18克拉玫瑰金镶嵌紫水晶和蓝色托帕石。

segments.en: It's a great statement piece.
segments.cn: 这是一个很棒的声明作品。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
segments.cn: 哦，哇。

segments.en: That's really pretty.
segments.cn: 这真的很漂亮。

segments.en: Jess would love that.
segments.cn: 杰斯会喜欢这个。

segments.en: But I was thinking of something a little more delicate, perhaps a necklace?
segments.cn: 但我在想一些更精致的东西，也许是项链？

segments.en: We have this beautiful platinum pendant, or you could also get her a locket.
segments.cn: 我们有这个漂亮的铂金吊坠，或者您也可以给她买一个怀表。

segments.en: You could also get her a timepiece.
segments.cn: 您也可以给她买一个手表。

segments.en: It's both glamorous and functional.
segments.cn: 它既华丽又实用。

segments.en: If you tell me a little more about your girlfriend, maybe I can help you find something for her.
segments.cn: 如果您能多告诉我一些关于您女朋友的事，也许我可以帮助您找到适合她的东西。

segments.en: Jess?
segments.cn: 杰斯？

segments.en: Well, she's very smart.
segments.cn: 嗯，她非常聪明。

segments.en: She has a great sense of humor.
segments.cn: 她有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: She's very feminine.
segments.cn: 她非常女性化。

segments.en: Perhaps you could give her a ring.
segments.cn: 也许您可以给她买一个戒指。

segments.en: Well, actually, I was thinking about asking Jess to marry me.
segments.cn: 嗯，实际上，我在考虑向杰斯求婚。

segments.en: I've just been so nervous.
segments.cn: 我一直很紧张。

segments.en: Well, sir, I believe your fifth anniversary is a great time to propose.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，我相信您的第五个周年纪念日是求婚的好时机。

segments.en: Okay, I've decided.
segments.cn: 好的，我决定了。

segments.en: I'm going to pop the question.
segments.cn: 我要向她求婚。

segments.en: Fabulous.
segments.cn: 太棒了。

segments.en: We should look at engagement rings then.
segments.cn: 那我们应该看看订婚戒指。

segments.en: Now that's a whole other section.
segments.cn: 现在那是另一个部分。

segments.en: All right, we're back.
segments.cn: 好的，我们回来了。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在让我们看看流利度提升器。

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 流利度提升器。

segments.en: So the first phrase in Fluency Builder today comes from the beginning of our dialogue, where Mark says to the shop assistant, Listen, I'm completely at a loss.
segments.cn: 所以今天流利度提升器中的第一个短语来自我们对话的开头，马克对店员说，听着，我完全不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: Okay, so what does he mean when he told the shopkeeper, I'm completely at a loss?
segments.cn: 好的，那么他说“我完全不知道该怎么办”是什么意思？

segments.en: At a loss means I have no idea.
segments.cn: 不知道该怎么办的意思是我没有主意。

segments.en: I'm really confused.
segments.cn: 我真的很困惑。

segments.en: Okay.
segments.cn: 好的。

segments.en: All right, I need help.
segments.cn: 好吧，我需要帮助。

segments.en: So if a teacher asks you a question and you don't know the answer, you can say, I'm sorry, I'm at a loss.
segments.cn: 所以如果老师问你一个问题，而你不知道答案，你可以说，我很抱歉，我不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: I'm at a loss.
segments.cn: 我不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: Or when I see someone and they say, Hi, how you doing?
segments.cn: 或者当我看到某人，他们说，嗨，你好吗？

segments.en: They say, Oh, I'm so embarrassed.
segments.cn: 他们说，哦，我太尴尬了。

segments.en: I'm really at a loss.
segments.cn: 我真的不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: I don't remember your name.
segments.cn: 我不记得你的名字了。

segments.en: Okay, very good.
segments.cn: 好的，非常好。

segments.en: So I'm at a loss.
segments.cn: 所以我不知道该怎么办。

segments.en: Now, when Mark was describing his girlfriend, Jess, he said, Well, she's very smart and has a great sense of humor.
segments.cn: 现在，当马克在描述他的女朋友杰斯时，他说，嗯，她非常聪明，并且有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: Okay, so sense of humor is a characteristic that we give to people.
segments.cn: 好的，所以幽默感是我们给人的一种特征。

segments.en: So he has no sense of humor, or she has a great sense of humor.
segments.cn: 所以他没有幽默感，或者她有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: And this means that this person likes to tell jokes and is funny and enjoys a good time, really.
segments.cn: 这意味着这个人喜欢讲笑话，幽默，享受美好时光。

segments.en: So it means that this person is not really that serious or always angry or unhappy?
segments.cn: 所以这意味着这个人并不太严肃，或者总是生气或不快乐？

segments.en: No, not an overly serious person.
segments.cn: 不，不是一个过于严肃的人。

segments.en: It generally means that the person is good at telling jokes and makes you laugh.
segments.cn: 这通常意味着这个人擅长讲笑话，让你笑。

segments.en: Okay, so Jess has a good sense of humor.
segments.cn: 好的，所以杰斯有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: And because of all these things, and they've been together for five years, Mark says, Okay, I've decided I'm going to pop the question.
segments.cn: 因为所有这些原因，他们在一起五年，马克说，好的，我决定我要向她求婚。

segments.en: Okay, this might sound very strange because you think, Well, pop the question.
segments.cn: 好的，这听起来可能很奇怪，因为你会想，嗯，求婚。

segments.en: What is the question?
segments.cn: 那个问题是什么？

segments.en: Well, in English, the phrase pop the question has a very special meaning.
segments.cn: 好吧，在英语中，短语“求婚”有一个非常特殊的含义。

segments.en: Means to ask someone to marry you.
segments.cn: 意思是向某人求婚。

segments.en: So if I say I'm going to pop the question, that means I'm going to ask someone to marry me.
segments.cn: 所以如果我说我要向她求婚，那意味着我要向某人求婚。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: Or you could say, He popped the question last night.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说，他昨晚求婚了。

segments.en: We're engaged.
segments.cn: 我们订婚了。

segments.en: Okay, so that means... He asked me to marry him.
segments.cn: 好的，这意味着……他向我求婚了。

segments.en: Okay, all right.
segments.cn: 好的，好的。

segments.en: So it's a phrase to pop the question.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个求婚的短语。

segments.en: So whenever you use it together, you're talking about asking someone to marry you.
segments.cn: 所以每当你一起使用它时，你是在谈论向某人求婚。

segments.en: Exactly.
segments.cn: 正是如此。

segments.en: All right, great stuff.
segments.cn: 好的，太好了。

segments.en: Why don't we go back and listen to this dialogue one last time?
segments.cn: 我们为什么不回去再听一遍这个对话呢？

segments.en: Good afternoon, sir.
segments.cn: 下午好，先生。

segments.en: Is there anything I can help you with today?
segments.cn: 今天有什么我可以帮您的吗？

segments.en: Um, yeah, I'm looking for a nice gift to give my girlfriend.
segments.cn: 嗯，是的，我在找一个送给我女朋友的好礼物。

segments.en: Our fifth anniversary is next Friday.
segments.cn: 我们的第五个周年纪念日是下周五。

segments.en: Well, I would be happy to assist you in choosing the perfect gift for her.
segments.cn: 好吧，我很乐意帮助您选择完美的礼物。

segments.en: Is there anything in particular that you have in mind?
segments.cn: 您有没有特别想要的东西？

segments.en: No, not really.
segments.cn: 不，没什么特别的。

segments.en: I'm completely at a loss.
segments.cn: 我完全不知道该买什么。

segments.en: Well, you can give her a set of Pearl earrings or this beautiful heart shaped pendant.
segments.cn: 好吧，您可以送她一套珍珠耳环或这个美丽的心形吊坠。

segments.en: What is her favorite gemstone?
segments.cn: 她最喜欢的宝石是什么？

segments.en: That purple one.
segments.cn: 那个紫色的。

segments.en: I'm sorry.
segments.cn: 对不起。

segments.en: I've never bought jewelry for anyone and I'm kind of nervous.
segments.cn: 我从来没有给任何人买过珠宝，我有点紧张。

segments.en: Don't worry, we specialize in providing our customers a relaxed, pressure free shopping environment.
segments.cn: 别担心，我们专注于为客户提供轻松、无压力的购物环境。

segments.en: That stone is an amethyst.
segments.cn: 那块石头是紫水晶。

segments.en: We have a range of beautiful amethyst pieces.
segments.cn: 我们有一系列美丽的紫水晶饰品。

segments.en: Take a look at this bracelet.
segments.cn: 看看这个手链。

segments.en: It's 18 karat Rose gold studded with amethyst and blue topaz.
segments.cn: 它是18K玫瑰金镶嵌紫水晶和蓝色托帕石。

segments.en: It's a great statement piece.
segments.cn: 这是一个很棒的声明作品。

segments.en: Oh, wow.
segments.cn: 哦，哇。

segments.en: That's really pretty.
segments.cn: 这真的很漂亮。

segments.en: Jess would love that.
segments.cn: 杰斯会喜欢这个。

segments.en: But I was thinking of something a little more delicate, perhaps a necklace?
segments.cn: 但我在想一些更精致的东西，也许是项链？

segments.en: We have this beautiful platinum pendant.
segments.cn: 我们有这个美丽的铂金吊坠。

segments.en: Or you could also get her a locket.
segments.cn: 或者你也可以给她一个挂坠。

segments.en: You could also get her a timepiece.
segments.cn: 你也可以给她一个手表。

segments.en: It's both glamorous and functional.
segments.cn: 它既华丽又实用。

segments.en: If you tell me a little more about your girlfriend, maybe I can help you find something for her.
segments.cn: 如果你多告诉我一些关于你女朋友的事，也许我可以帮你找到适合她的东西。

segments.en: Jess?
segments.cn: 杰斯？

segments.en: Well, she's very smart.
segments.cn: 她非常聪明。

segments.en: She has a great sense of humor.
segments.cn: 她有很好的幽默感。

segments.en: She's very feminine.
segments.cn: 她非常女性化。

segments.en: Perhaps you could give her a ring.
segments.cn: 也许你可以给她一个戒指。

segments.en: Well, actually, I was thinking about asking Jess to marry me.
segments.cn: 其实，我在想要向杰斯求婚。

segments.en: I've just been so nervous.
segments.cn: 我一直很紧张。

segments.en: Well, sir, I believe your fifth anniversary is a great time to propose.
segments.cn: 好吧，先生，我相信你们的第五个周年纪念日是个求婚的好时机。

segments.en: Okay, I've decided.
segments.cn: 好吧，我决定了。

segments.en: I'm going to pop the question.
segments.cn: 我要求婚了。

segments.en: Fabulous.
segments.cn: 太棒了。

segments.en: We should look at engagement rings then.
segments.cn: 那我们应该看看订婚戒指。

segments.en: Now, that's a whole other section.
segments.cn: 现在，那是另一个部分。

segments.en: So talking about jewelry and all of these gemstones, we also took a look at different metal types.
segments.cn: 所以谈到珠宝和所有这些宝石，我们还看了不同的金属类型。

segments.en: We talked about gold, which is, I think, one of the most popular types of metals.
segments.cn: 我们谈到了黄金，我认为这是最受欢迎的金属类型之一。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: It's kind of like a yellow color.
segments.cn: 它有点像黄色。

segments.en: Now, when we talk about gold, we talk about 14 carat, 18 carat, 24 carat, stuff like this.
segments.cn: 现在，当我们谈论黄金时，我们谈论14K、18K、24K之类的东西。

segments.en: Yeah, so the carat, usually it's abbreviated like a K, 18K, 14K.
segments.cn: 是的，所以克拉通常缩写为K，18K，14K。

segments.en: It means how pure the gold is.
segments.cn: 它表示黄金的纯度。

segments.en: Okay, and actually they also use it in diamonds.
segments.cn: 好的，实际上它们也用于钻石。

segments.en: They talk about a diamond that's one carat or two carats.
segments.cn: 他们谈论一颗一克拉或两克拉的钻石。

segments.en: Right, so in diamonds it has a different meaning.
segments.cn: 对，所以在钻石中它有不同的含义。

segments.en: It actually means how much the diamond weighs.
segments.cn: 它实际上表示钻石的重量。

segments.en: So some engagement rings are half a carat or a carat.
segments.cn: 所以一些订婚戒指是半克拉或一克拉。

segments.en: And the really, really, really big ones are like two carats, and those are very expensive.
segments.cn: 而那些非常非常大的戒指是两克拉，那些非常昂贵。

segments.en: That's right.
segments.cn: 没错。

segments.en: And we also saw another metal here, platinum, which is a very nice metal.
segments.cn: 我们还看到另一种金属，铂金，这是一种非常好的金属。

segments.en: It looks like silver, but it's stronger.
segments.cn: 它看起来像银，但更坚固。

segments.en: It's much stronger, so you can hit something and it won't leave an impression.
segments.cn: 它更坚固，所以你可以敲打东西，它不会留下印记。

segments.en: It won't change the look of the metal.
segments.cn: 它不会改变金属的外观。

segments.en: And this is very popular right now for wedding bands.
segments.cn: 这在现在的婚戒中非常受欢迎。

segments.en: You know those rings that men and women get after they're married?
segments.cn: 你知道那些男人和女人在结婚后得到的戒指吗？

segments.en: Many people like to get this silvery looking platinum ring.
segments.cn: 很多人喜欢得到这种银色的铂金戒指。

segments.en: I've actually seen different types of metals that weren't mentioned in the dialogue, like titanium rings.
segments.cn: 我实际上见过对话中没有提到的不同类型的金属，比如钛戒指。

segments.en: Titanium is also a very strong metal.
segments.cn: 钛也是一种非常坚固的金属。

segments.en: I can't remember this metal, but it's used on spacecraft, and it's very, very strong.
segments.cn: 我记不清这种金属，但它用于航天器，非常非常坚固。

segments.en: Stronger than titanium.
segments.cn: 比钛更坚固。

segments.en: I don't know what it is.
segments.cn: 我不知道是什么。

segments.en: Yeah, they also make rings out of it.
segments.cn: 是的，他们也用它制作戒指。

segments.en: But another interesting thing is some people make their own rings.
segments.cn: 但另一个有趣的事情是，有些人自己制作戒指。

segments.en: Their wedding bands or their wedding rings.
segments.cn: 他们的婚戒或结婚戒指。

segments.en: I've seen that.
segments.cn: 我见过。

segments.en: It's a very nice thing to do, I think, because it's meaningful.
segments.cn: 我认为这是一个非常好的事情，因为它很有意义。

segments.en: People like to do it together, and then they have these rings that are very special for them.
segments.cn: 人们喜欢一起做，然后他们有这些对他们来说非常特别的戒指。

segments.en: So a person that makes jewelry or makes rings is called a jeweler, right?
segments.cn: 所以制作珠宝或戒指的人叫做珠宝商，对吗？

segments.en: A jeweler, that's right.
segments.cn: 珠宝商，没错。

segments.en: So I have a friend who is a jeweler.
segments.cn: 我有一个朋友是珠宝商。

segments.en: He makes beautiful rings and earrings.
segments.cn: 他制作美丽的戒指和耳环。

segments.en: Okay, so not only rings, a person that makes jewelry in general can be called a jeweler.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以不仅是戒指，制作珠宝的人一般也可以称为珠宝商。

segments.en: All right, a very interesting topic, especially for the girls who always love to have rings and diamonds and necklaces.
segments.cn: 好吧，这是一个非常有趣的话题，尤其是对于那些总是喜欢戒指、钻石和项链的女孩。

segments.en: Or the boys.
segments.cn: 或者男孩。

segments.en: I know some boys really like to get earrings or to have jewelry like a ring.
segments.cn: 我知道有些男孩真的喜欢戴耳环或有像戒指这样的珠宝。

segments.en: I've never really seen too many guys wearing necklaces, though.
segments.cn: 不过，我真的没见过太多男孩戴项链。

segments.en: A lot of guys wear cross necklaces, I've seen.
segments.cn: 很多男孩戴十字架项链，我见过。

segments.en: Or rings, not too many rings.
segments.cn: 或者戒指，不太多戒指。

segments.en: I don't think it's a big thing.
segments.cn: 我觉得这不是个大事。

segments.en: Wedding rings, yeah.
segments.cn: 婚戒，是的。

segments.en: A lot of American guys wear rings.
segments.cn: 很多美国男孩戴戒指。

segments.en: Oh, yeah?
segments.cn: 哦，是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I think, well, not a lot, but some do.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得，嗯，不是很多，但有些人会。

segments.en: So, well, obviously, it's popular all around.
segments.cn: 所以，显然，这在各地都很受欢迎。

segments.en: And of course, we are interested in hearing from you guys.
segments.cn: 当然，我们很想听听你们的意见。

segments.en: So if you have any questions or any other suggestions about this lesson or anything, you can always find us at EnglishPod.com.
segments.cn: 如果你们对这节课或其他任何事情有问题或建议，可以随时在 EnglishPod.com 找到我们。

segments.en: We hope to see you guys there.
segments.cn: 我们希望在那里见到你们。

segments.en: All right.
segments.cn: 好的。
